ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Operations version 2 =- take it if you like math!
Yes, and to a wide range of students.
I recommend the courseIt's. Certainly the best and my fav courses
I would highly recommend this course to another student
- I would recommend the course to other particularly to those students interested in careers in Consulting or Investment Banking.
This class was a lot of work, but the work was very interesting and worth while. I learned how to think about different everyday situations and different ways to think about math and statistics.
It's not directly relevant to my research. But it helped my math. I would recommend it.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: It will contribute to future research and has contributed to idea generation already.
IComing from a non math non SOM backgroundThe course provided a lot of math probability insights
I took this course after taking Cost Effective Analysis at the School of Public Health. This course was a great introductory course into modeling.
- I taught me structured problem solving and allowed me to apply techniques to in unfamiliar settings

I learned a lot about general ways to think about every day problems that occur in many different fields. I am sure that the things we talked about will pertain to my research, I just haven't figured out how it has yet.
I understand distributions a bit better. At NEMC, there was one talk that I could follow better because of stuff that Ed mentioned in class.
